fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When searching for BOARD related entries in the Audit log, there are entries in English, and also in German and other non-latin script languages instead of the system default. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Replace the Jira software license with a DC license or use a DC Jira instance.
- Enable "Full" Auditing option to "End User Activity"
- Create a new user, choose the default user language "German", or any non-latin script alphabet (Chinese, Japanese, Korean) from the Profile Preferences:
!Screenshot 2021-03-09 at 8.53.32 PM.png|thumbnail! 
- Keep Default language on System info page, in this example "English"
- Perform any BOARD operation (create or delete a board)
- Go to Audit logs and select boards in the category. 
- There is a mix of language - English and other languages entries in Audit logs, mainly date/time and operation Summary:
*German*
 !Screenshot 2021-03-09 at 8.58.41 PM.png|thumbnail! 
*Non-latin script alphabet language*
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
When searching for entries in the Audit Log, all entries should be in English.

h3. Actual Results
There is a language mix-up in the Audit log.

h3. Workaround
Configure the [default language to user profiles|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver0816/configuring-the-user-default-settings-1063164221.html], have users keep the default settings.
fields.summary: Mixed up language in the Audit log

fields.description:
The /rest/api/1.0/render resource in Jira Server and Data Center before version 8.5.13, from version 8.6.0 before version 8.13.5, and from version 8.14.0 before version 8.15.1 allows remote anonymous attackers to determine if a username is valid or not via a missing permissions check.


 

*Affected versions:*
 * version < 8.5.13
 * 8.6.0 ≤ version < 8.13.5
 * 8.14.0 ≤ version < 8.15.1

*Fixed versions:*
 * 8.5.13
 * 8.13.5
 * 8.15.1
fields.summary: Username Enumeration through the render api resource - CVE-2020-36238

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

ProjectRoleActorsZduSafeCache uses a composite key based on <projectId,roleId>. Some components (like JQL validation, as used in the test below) iterate over entries of this cache for *all projects*. Hence, when this cache is fully flushed, it's aggressively loaded back via multiple threads using such components. This causes many concurrent cache load requests, which may block temporarily on each other due to lock contention on cache stripes. The amount of delay caused by this lock contention may become noticeable on large instances with high load, a large web-container thread pool and a large number of projects.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

The issue may be reproduced with a load test. The amount of delay that can be observed depends on the size of test data, load and test hardware.
 # Set up a load test to generate concurrent issue search load on the system. This may be a call to issue search REST API like {{/rest/api/2/search?jql=comment~test}}. Use a JQL that refers to a component (this triggers a permission check), i.e. in the example provided, the component is {{comment}}
 # After the test warmup period, flush the ProjectRoleActorsZduSafeCache by creating a new empty {{Group}} at {{Administration/User management/Groups}}, and then deleting this {{Group}}
 # you may observe stalled requests on the load test tool and verify the issue with threaddumps during this period

h4. Operations that are known to trigger this bug
 - deleting a User
 - deleting a Group
 - anonymizing a User
 - Project import

h4. Sample stack traces indicating the problem
 - many blocked threads with the stack
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results

ProjectRoleActorsZduSafeCache is repopulated after a flush without causing a noticeable impact on server responsiveness
h3. Actual Results
A temporary lock contention may result after the cache is flushed, causing noticeable hit to responsiveness

h3. Note on fix
The problem was mitigated by changing the cache flush logic: _only entries associated with projects where the user/group is a role actor will be invalidated._

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available

h3. Problem
When uploading MP4 files, it will be attached as a file, which doesn't have a preview. But if instead you change the square brackets for exclamation points, it will be shown in a preview and you will be able to play the video in the comments section.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

This ticket is used to track a bug on RDS - after Postgres 10 upgrade, Jira may fail to start.

[https://dba.stackexchange.com/questions/237359/aws-rds-postgresql-master-user-lost-all-privileges-after-upgrading-from-v9-6]

When ugprading to Postgres 10 on AWS RDS, Jira can't start. 
 It's because after upgrade, public schema lost access privileges.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Connect to postgres sever (psql)
 # connect to jira database by \c <jiradb>
 # list out schemas \dn+

h3. Expected Results
 # rdsadmin user has access privileges

{code:java}
                          List of schemas
  Name  |  Owner   |  Access privileges   |      Description
--------+----------+----------------------+------------------------
 public | rdsadmin | rdsadmin=UC/rdsadmin+| standard public schema
        |          | =UC/rdsadmin         |
(1 row)
{code}
h3. Actual Results
 # access privileges are lost.
{code:java}
    List of schemas
  Name  |  Owner   | Access privileges |      Description
--------+----------+-------------------+------------------------
 public | rdsadmin |                   | standard public schema
(1 row)
{code}

h3. Workaround

Grant schema access to confluence user.
{code:java}
confluence=> ALTER SCHEMA public OWNER to <jira_db_user>;
ALTER SCHEMA
confluence=> GRANT ALL ON SCHEMA public TO <jira_db_user>;
GRANT
{code}
fields.summary: Postgres upgrade on AWS RDS Jira can't find tables

fields.description:
h3. *Problem:*

The request to *GET /rest/api/2/issue/issueIdOrKey* returns a full representation of the issue for the given issue key, including a list of the linked issues (issuelinks).

However, If the linked issue belongs to another Jira instance (remote link), the REST end point's response body does not contain details about this link, returning only the issuelinks related to the own Jira instance.
h3. *Impact of this behavior:*
 # It is not trusted information, as the information returned is incomplete;
 # There is no mention that there are remote links on this issue;
 # As there is no mention that the issue could have remote links, we need to issue 2 requests for each issue: one to the API  *GET /rest/api/2/issue/issueIdOrKey*, the other to */rest/api/2/issue/IssueIdorKey/remotelink*, only to get the remote links (if any).
 # *This means that we need to make 2 calls instead of 1 to find the issuelinks and doubling the number of calls on our instances (which are very huge) is not efficient.*

 
 *Steps to reproduce*
 * At the Application Links, add a connection to another Jira instance;
 * Edit an issue
 * Add a link to another issue (same Jira instance)
 * Add a second link to an issue located on the other Jira instance
 * Call the REST API GET /rest/api/2/issue/issueIdOrKey

*What is expected*
 JSON returned with the full representation of the issue, including the remotelink information (RELATIONSHIP, URL, TITLE).
  
 *What is observed instead?*
 * Only the first link is returned, with no indication that this issue does contains also a remote link. 
 !Screen Shot 2021-03-19 at 11.22.43.png|width=281,height=139!
fields.summary: As a developer, I want to get also the remote links information when calling the GET ISSUE API

fields.description:
The request to *GET /rest/api/2/issue/issueIdOrKey* returns a full representation of the issue for the given issue key, including a list of the linked issues (issuelinks).

However, If the linked issue belongs to another Jira instance, the REST end point's response body does not contain details about this link.

Our documentation at [JIRA Server platform REST API reference|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/8.5.12/#api/2/issue-getIssue] should mention that the request *GET /rest/api/2/issue/issueIdOrKey* does not return remote links, and in order to get this data, we should run another API: */rest/api/2/issue/IssueIdorKey/remotelink.*
fields.summary: Improve REST/API documentation for the issuelinks returned by the get Issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When accessing Jira issue datetime fields through the Jira icalendar plugin (Confluence Team Calendar integration) Reproduced on Jira 8.8.0 and 8.13.2 with icalendar plugin 1.8.2
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create Jira and Confluence instance with Server time as CDT (Chicago)
 # Set your User time in both instances to New York
 # Create custom fields with datetime type data
 # Set the dates for the following, and access these events in Jira Team Calendars: some dates return incorrectly in the response from Jira - see changes from Jira Icalendar plugin version 1.8.0 to 1.8.2:

14th March 2020:

1.32 AM  -> 1.32 AM
 3.32 AM -> 3.31 AM
 4.32 AM -> 4.32 AM
 5.32 AM -> 4.32 AM

15th March 2020:
 1.14 AM -> 12.14 AM
 2.32 AM -> 1.32 AM
 3.14 AM -> 3.14 AM
 4.14 AM -> 4.14 AM
h3. Expected Results

The times returned from the icalendar plugin would be the same as previously.
h3. Actual Results

The times are off by 1 hour between 5AM 14th March and 2AM 15th March, in the day where the Daylight savings change happens.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Accessing Jira through Confluence team calendars gives the wrong time during first day of daylight savings

Since version 8.16 of Jira Data Center administrators can set a default value on the _Description_ field per project. You can learn more about it how it works [here.|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracore/preparing-for-jira-8-16-1044779603.html]

We would really appreciate your comments and feedback on the released capabilities. We would love to hear also what are the most important features that you would like to be added to Jira Data Center for Default Values of System Fields.

Thank you,
 Grażyna Kaszkur
 Product Manager, Jira Server and Data Center
fields.summary: Feedback on Default Values of System Fields

fields.description:
h2. Problem

It is recommended to add context to custom fields for performance reasons. However, in the following really common use case it is more or less impossible to administer:
 * You have more than just a few custom fields with a context on a project
 * You need to create projects with the same configurations from time to time.

This means that every time you want to create a new project with the same configuration you need to go through all the custom fields used in the project and add the newly created project to the field's context. And with the current interface for configuring context this is really easy to make a mistake.
h2. Possible solution 

Add the context configuration into the Field configuration scheme. Thus in the field configuration you would determine which fields should be used for projects using this configuration. You would also set default values and options. This would be a logical setup for the admin - today configuration for showing fields are split on many different places. We would get these advantages:
 * Ability to share context in an easy way between projects.
 * Make it possible to have more than one context per project as field configurations are setup per issue type
 * Make it easier to understand which fields are actually used and shown in a project.

h2. Alternate solution

Create a configuration element "Field Context Scheme" configuration which can be shared between projects in the same way as other schemes. In this you would configure show/hide, options and default values. This would more or less give the same advantages as solution above, but would still have configuration for field on different places.
fields.summary: Add Custom field context to Field configuration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The message that is shown if there are any errors with Indexing is misleading and causes concern.
{code:java}
2018-11-13 10:00:27,704 IssueIndexer:thread-31 INFO admin 1139x124894x1 1s 127.0.0.1 /secure/admin/IndexReIndex.jspa [c.a.j.w.a.admin.index.IndexAdminImpl] Re-indexing is 98% complete. Current index: Issue
2018-11-13 10:01:07,436 JiraTaskExectionThread-1 ERROR admin 1139x124894x1 1s 127.0.0.1 /secure/admin/IndexReIndex.jspa [c.a.j.util.index.CompositeIndexLifecycleManager] Reindex All FAILED. Indexer: DefaultIndexManager: paths: [/jira/caches/indexes/comments, /jira/caches/indexes/issues, /jira/caches/indexes/changes, /jira/caches/indexes/worklogs, /jira/caches/indexes/plugins/jira-git-files, /jira/caches/indexes/plugins/jira-git-pullrequestinfos, /jira/caches/indexes/plugins/jira-git-revisions]
com.atlassian.jira.index.IndexingFailureException: Indexing completed with 2 errors
{code}
Specifically the two sections:
{code:java}
Reindex All FAILED
........
Indexing completed with 2 errors{code}
The message *Reindex All FAILED* makes users worried and leads them to believe that the whole indexing process has not been successful. The actuality is that the indexing process has completed but ran into some errors along the way, hence (Indexing completed with 2 errors).

We also note this in our documentation:
 _From_ [_Troubleshoot a Reindex failure in Jira_|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/troubleshoot-a-reindex-failure-in-jira-server-429917142.html]
{quote}When JIRA applications perform a reindex, errors can happen throughout that process. If an error occurs, exceptions will typically be thrown for individual issues. This means the index can fail for a single issue; however, it does not fail for the entire instance because one issue is causing problems. If the above exception and stack trace is displayed after indexing has finished, it means one or more of the issues failed during the process; however, the entire process did not. It's highly likely that part of the instance has been successfully indexed.
{quote}
h3. Expected Results

Change this to(Or something similar)
{code:java}
2018-11-13 10:01:07,436 JiraTaskExectionThread-1 ERROR admin 1139x124894x1 1s 127.0.0.1 /secure/admin/IndexReIndex.jspa [c.a.j.util.index.CompositeIndexLifecycleManager] Reindex All complete but ran into [x] errors Indexer: DefaultIndexManager: paths: [/jira/caches/indexes/comments, /jira/caches/indexes/issues, /jira/caches/indexes/changes, /jira/caches/indexes/worklogs, /jira/caches/indexes/plugins/jira-git-files, /jira/caches/indexes/plugins/jira-git-pullrequestinfos, /jira/caches/indexes/plugins/jira-git-revisions] com.atlassian.jira.index.IndexingFailureException: Indexing completed with 2 errors{code}
 *  Removing the {{Reindex All Failed}}
 ** Changing this to Reindex Complete but ran into [X] errors
 ** Where X is the number of errors if possible 

h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
2018-11-13 10:01:07,436 JiraTaskExectionThread-1 ERROR admin 1139x124894x1 1s 127.0.0.1 /secure/admin/IndexReIndex.jspa [c.a.j.util.index.CompositeIndexLifecycleManager] Reindex All FAILED. Indexer: DefaultIndexManager: paths: [/jira/caches/indexes/comments, /jira/caches/indexes/issues, /jira/caches/indexes/changes, /jira/caches/indexes/worklogs, /jira/caches/indexes/plugins/jira-git-files, /jira/caches/indexes/plugins/jira-git-pullrequestinfos, /jira/caches/indexes/plugins/jira-git-revisions] com.atlassian.jira.index.IndexingFailureException: Indexing completed with 2 errors
{noformat}
h3. Steps to reproduce
 * Start a Full Reindex in Jira
 * Encounter an error during the indexing process
 * This message will be shown at the end. 

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira Lucene Reindexing message is misleading.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a Project has two issue-types Bug and Suggestion and both the issue-types have different Field configuration schemes say "Bug Scheme" and "Suggestion Scheme" respectively. Now, if we set the default description in "Bug Scheme" using the javascript, the description is shown correctly when creating the issue-type Bug, but when we switch the issue-type to Suggestion, the default description still persists in the description box, although no default description is set for Filed Configuration scheme for Issue-type suggestion.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a New Project with two issue-types Bug and Suggestion.
 # Associate Field configuration scheme "Bug Scheme" with Issue-type Bug and "Suggestion Scheme" with the Issue-type suggestion.
 # Edit the Field configuration scheme "Bug Scheme" and search for the *Description* field and click Edit.
 # In the description box, enter the below javascript and save it.

{noformat}
<script type="text/javascript">
if (document.getElementById("description").value == '')
{ document.getElementById("description").value = "*Steps to Reproduce* \n\n\n\n*Expected Results* \n\n\n\n*Actual Results* \n"; }
</script>{noformat}
      5. Press the Create button and Select Issue-type Bug and then switch to Issue-type    suggestion
h3. Expected Results

The Default description set using javascript should be shown for issue-type Bug, but when changing to Issue-type suggestion, it should be removed.
h3. Actual Results

The Default description set using javascript is shown for issue-type Bug, but when changing to Issue-type suggestion, it still persists.
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

No Workaround
fields.summary: Default description set using Javascript for an Issue-type in One Field Configuration Scheme is not getting removed when switching to other Issue-type using different Field Configuration Scheme,

Hello team, 

We are using Jira Server for Slack app and would like to suggest adding a delay for notifications. 

The reason for this is because we use Jira Service Desk (JSD) and ProForma to collect issues from our users. In the JSD Request Type we set a dummy value for Summary (as it is required) which is then replaced by a ProForma linked field. 

With the current configuration of Slack Notifications, the dummy value is sent through in the notification, because it is triggered before the ProForma form makes the update.

h3. Issue Summary

If system administrator modifies the location of {{atlassian-confluence.log}} file following the steps defined on our documentation [Logging and profiling|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver085/logging-and-profiling-981155508.html], the log is not included more in the Support zip file.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Follow the steps from 
 [Logging and profiling|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver085/logging-and-profiling-981155508.html] at the "Changing the location of the log" section.

h3. Expected Results
Support.zip should include the log

h3. Actual Results
Support.zip does not include the log.

While the issue is not fixed, it would be better if there was an warning at the instructions on [Logging and profiling|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver085/logging-and-profiling-981155508.html] advising that it will not be included at the support.zip.

fields.description:
If system administrator modified the location of {{atlassian-jira
 .log}} file following the steps defined on our documentation [Logging and profiling|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver085/logging-and-profiling-981155508.html] it doesn't show in Support zip file:
h6. Steps to reproduce:
 # Stop Jira
 # Delete {{JIRA_HOME/logs/atlassian-jira.log*}}
 # Edit {{atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/log4j.properties}} to specify another directory as
{code:java}
log4j.appender.filelog=org.apache.log4j.RollingFileAppender
log4j.appender.filelog.File=/tmp/test/atlassian-jira.log
{code}

 # Restart Jira and check if {{/tmp/test/atlassian-jira.log}} is there.
 # Go to Jira Admin >Support Tools, create Support Zip file

h6. Actual Result:

Support zip file doesn't contain the {{atlassian-jira.log}} files.
h6. Expected Result:

Support zip should have {{atlassian-jira.log}} file.
h6. Workaround:

Two appenders can be used in logging, therefore original appender will be kept intact. 
In the below example a new appended *secondlog* is added to log4j configuration which is logging to path */opt/jira/logs/atlassian-jira.log*
{noformat}
log4j.appender.secondlog=org.apache.log4j.RollingFileAppender
log4j.appender.secondlog.File=/opt/jira/logs/atlassian-jira.log
log4j.appender.secondlog.MaxFileSize=20480KB
log4j.appender.secondlog.MaxBackupIndex=10
log4j.appender.secondlog.layout=com.atlassian.logging.log4j.NewLineIndentingFilteringPatternLayout
log4j.appender.secondlog.layout.ConversionPattern=%d{yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss,SSSZ} %t %p %X{jira.username} %X{jira.request.id} %X{jira.request.assession.id} %X{jira.request.ipaddr} %X{jira.request.url} [%q{2}] %m%n
# re-enable when JDEV-33891 is resolved or improved
log4j.appender.secondlog.layout.StackTracePackagingExamined=false
log4j.appender.secondlog.layout.MinimumLines=6
log4j.appender.secondlog.layout.ShowEludedSummary=false
log4j.appender.secondlog.layout.FilteringApplied=true
log4j.appender.secondlog.layout.FilteredFrames=@jira-filtered-frames.properties
{noformat}
You should also add the new appenders to the rootLogger and other package configurations.
{noformat}
# To turn more verbose logging on - change "WARN" to "DEBUG"
log4j.rootLogger=WARN, filelog, secondlog

....
....

log4j.logger.com.atlassian = WARN, filelog, secondlog
log4j.additivity.com.atlassian = false

log4j.logger.com.atlassian.jira = INFO, filelog, secondlog
log4j.additivity.com.atlassian.jira = false
{noformat}
fields.summary: Support zip file doesn't contain application logs if the location modified

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Calling POST on the endpoint {{/rest/api/2/user}} using *personal access token* ( [released in Jira 8.14|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-8-14-x-release-notes-1027133861.html] ) throws status code 401 :
{code}
{"message":"This resource requires WebSudo.","status-code":401}
{code}

h3. Environment
Tested on 
* Jira 8.14 & Jira 8.15
* Server & Data Center

h3. Steps to Reproduce
#  Create a personal access token : https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/using-personal-access-tokens-1026032365.html
# Hit the following REST API endpoint POST /rest/api/2/user for example :
{code}
curl -X POST 'http://localhost:48150/j8150/rest/api/2/user' \
> -H 'Authorization: Bearer NzMwMjk2NjQ2NDU1OkULPrfTFnm2rlkW+8yk+l0yXAqY' \
> -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
> -H 'Accept: application/json' \
> -H 'X-Atlassian-Token: no-check' \
> -d '{"name": "test", "displayName": "Test User", "emailAddress": "test@test.foo", "applicationKeys": ["jira-software"]}'
{code}


h3. Expected Results
User should be created for example :
{code}
{"self":"http://localhost:48150/j8150/rest/api/2/user?username=test222","key":"JIRAUSER10200","name":"test222","emailAddress":"test222@test.foo","avatarUrls":{"48x48":"https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/9fa50e1d623910382d5af1f9db0ff898?d=mm&s=48","24x24":"https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/9fa50e1d623910382d5af1f9db0ff898?d=mm&s=24","16x16":"https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/9fa50e1d623910382d5af1f9db0ff898?d=mm&s=16","32x32":"https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/9fa50e1d623910382d5af1f9db0ff898?d=mm&s=32"},"displayName":"Test User222","active":true,"deleted":false,"timeZone":"Europe/Amsterdam","locale":"en_NL","groups":{"size":1,"items":[]},"applicationRoles":{"size":1,"items":[]},"expand":"groups,applicationRoles"}
{code}


h3. Actual Results
User not created with this status code returned :
{code}
{"message":"This resource requires WebSudo.","status-code":401}
{code}

h3. Workaround

h4. Workaround 1
Use basic authentication 

h4. Workaround 2
Disable websudo (  secure administrator sessions ) following the steps here :
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/configuring-secure-administrator-sessions-938847890.html#Configuringsecureadministratorsessions-Disablingsecureadministratorsessions

h3. Notes
fields.summary: 401 error when calling POST /rest/api/2/user using personal access token

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As part of the fix in JRASERVER-42916 we have new {{NodeAutoShutdownIfOfflineService}}
It's responsible for killing and shutting down Jira node. As part of Online check, a node can be automatically flagged as OFFLINE node, so Jira needs to prevent cluster caches corruption. If a node is in the OFFLINE state, other nodes in the cluster stop cache replication. Due to this fact, a node will be scanning its own state. 

(i)If it will detect that was marked as OFFLINE, this Jira node will exit in panic mode. Example logging: 
{noformat}
2021-02-10 11:28:38,632+0000 heartbeat-scheduler-0 ERROR      [c.a.j.cluster.service.NodeAutoShutdownIfOfflineService] [CLUSTER-STATE] This node NODE2 was moved to OFFLINE by another node. This node needs to be shut down as soon as possible.
2021-02-10 11:28:38,632+0000 heartbeat-scheduler-0 ERROR      [c.a.jira.startup.JiraShutdown] This Jira instance was requested to exit in panic mode
java.lang.Exception
	at com.atlassian.jira.startup.JiraShutdown.panic(JiraShutdown.java:19)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.service.NodeAutoShutdownIfOfflineService.checkCurrentNodeState(NodeAutoShutdownIfOfflineService.java:78)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.lock.ClusterHeartbeatJob.run(ClusterHeartbeatJob.java:36)
	at 
{noformat}

Sometimes it's not clear why marked the node offline and what's the current status of the Cluster Hearbeat for the current node. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add debug logging into {{NodeAutoShutdownIfOfflineService.class}} which will show details about stale node state.

h3. Workaround 
Run queries manually
{code:SQL|borderStyle=solid}
SELECT * FROM clusternodeheartbeat;
SELECT NODE_ID FROM clusternodeheartbeat WHERE (HEARTBEAT_TIME >  '<NOW - 2 DAYS>' )
{code}
fields.summary: Improve Jira logging for NodeAutoShutdownIfOfflineService

fields.description: Currently in the Sprint Board it is not possible to view a Bug associated with a User Story as you would a sub task associated with a User Story. fields.summary: Need multilevel hierarchy for Bug Issue Type

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Jira Server*. Using *Jira Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-76147].
  {panel}

h3. Issue Summary

When searching JQL using the [WAS operator|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/advanced-searching-operators-reference-939938745.html#Advancedsearching-operatorsreference-WASWAS] it is possible to easily construct a JQL query to see which user made a specific change. 
 For example, if you wanted to know if user jsmith changed the status of an issue to done, you could find these with:
{code:java}
status WAS Done BY jsmith 
{code}
However the problem here is that the issue navigator in Jira Server will not attempt to autocomplete the username based on the input here. This feels inconsistent with the behavior that is displayed for assignee or reporter fields. When you search those fields, the issue navigator will attempt to search for users that match that string in some way.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In the issue navigator attempt to type out a search such as
{code:java}
status WAS Done BY jsmit
{code}

h3. Expected Results

When typing this out, we would expect that Jira would show you a list of any users that match that string of 'jsmit' so far and let you select one.

h3. Actual Results
 * The Issue Navigator does not offer any possible suggestion based on the input string here.
 * This makes it very difficult for Jira users to utilize JQL in order to quickly and easily find these issues that were changed by a specific individual.

h3. Workaround

It is possible to instead use the Account ID of the user and use that to query in JQL. However, you have to do some other work first to find this value, which feels overly tedious. You can find this in a few different ways:
 # You can run a different JQL query first such as
{code:java}
reporter='Full Name' 
{code}
Which can then help you to locate that username for use in this first query.
fields.summary: JQL search using WAS operator and BY predicates does not auto populate username based on string

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unlicensed users without any application access can be assigned to project roles. 

Since Jira Software users can't do anything without a license (unlike JSD where there are portal users), it's counterintuitive and confusing that the 'Add users to a role' button in a project's Users and Roles page lets you add an unlicensed user to a role.  Project admins add a user, not knowing they're unlicensed, and then don't understand why that user can't do anything.
This is more seen when customer has both Jira software and Jira service desk application on the same server and connected to the user directory including the Jira licensed users and customers (unlicensed users). If it was only Jira software, we need to deactivate the users without the application access. 


h3. Workaround

*  If it was only Jira software, we need to deactivate the users without the application access. 
*  Plan on installing Jira Software and Jira service desk on their dedicated servers connected to their dedicated user directories to avoid running into this issue.
fields.summary: Unlicensed users without any application access can be assigned to project roles.

Having the ability to edit this configuration through the REST API would be useful when automating some administration tasks.


h3. Suggested Solution
Make it possible to manage workflow transitions behavior (conditions, validators, post functions, etc) through the REST API, similar to the [Workflow transition rules|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-workflow-transition-rules/] in Jira Cloud.

Currently this information is not obtainable since the *Login Count* is an incremented value within the database.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
External applications integrated to Jira through Application Links can make calls on-behalf of users when authorized to, making use of [OAuth tokens|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/jira/platform/oauth/].

The access token persists for 5 years, unless it is revoked.
Revoking an OAuth access token is an action that can be performed solely by the user who owns this token, which is described in [Allowing OAuth access|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver/allowing-oauth-access-939937946.html].

When an user is inactivated (disabled), their OAuth tokens aren't revoked by default.
Although requests made with this token won't get through the application permissions (authorization validation), it would be good to have them deleted.

h3. Suggested Solution
When users are disabled, revoke/delete all of their OAuth access tokens.
 
h3. Workaround 
# Identify the OAuth tokens associated to inactive users.
{code:sql}
select au.lower_user_name, ot.token
from oauthsptoken ot
join app_user au on au.user_key=ot.username
join cwd_user cu on cu.id=au.id
where cu.active = 0
and ot.token_type='ACCESS'
;
{code}
# Delete OAuth tokens associated to inactive users.
{code:sql}
DELETE FROM oauthsptoken
WHERE ID IN (
	select ot.id
	from oauthsptoken ot
	join app_user au on au.user_key=ot.username
	join cwd_user cu on cu.id=au.id
	where cu.active = 0
	and ot.token_type='ACCESS'
);
{code}
fields.summary: As a Jira administrator I would like that OAuth tokens are removed when a user is disabled (inactive)

fields.description:
Please add an item in the [upgrade checklist|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/upgrade-checklist-966063320.html].

If upgrading from a version before 8.12, there's a chance that MySQL 5.6 was being used before, and we've [removed its support|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/end-of-support-announcements-938846831.html].

In this case:
 * The {{dbconfig.xml}} must be updated from using {{mysql}} to use {{mysql57}} or {{mysql8}} as the database type.
 * The collation should be converted to {{utf8mb4}} as detailed in [https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/how-to-fix-the-collation-and-character-set-of-a-mysql-database-manually-744326173.html]
fields.summary: Add item regarding MySQL 5.6 end of support in the upgrade checklist

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
After upgrading to JIRA 8.10.0 and later, including the LTS release 8.13.0, the background reindex operations may be slower (0-20%) than it was in previous Jira versions. (i) The extra cost is caused by *higher index consistency* ("_conditional update_" is one of the steps to ensure consistency). The performance overhead is connected with creating multiple Lucene index readers in same request. 

See also [Background reindex is slow after upgrading to Jira 8.10 and later|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/background-reindex-is-slow-after-upgrading-to-jira-8-10-and-later-1027126085.html]

h3. Suggested Solution
* Create index searcher once and never invalidate it. This is under assumption that  index searcher needs to only be accurate about issues that are not in the cache
* Increase the cache size x100 (capacity 100,000). The searcher never gets invalidated, unless the cache is also invalidated. 
** This means we pay the cost of invalidating the searcher much less frequently. 
 
h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: Reduce performance cost of conditional updates

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira relies on [Lucene|https://lucene.apache.org/] for its indexing capabilities.
If there's an NFS mount broken (stale, hung or inaccessible) in the Linux server running Jira, then any Lucene index related feature might break because of it, even if the file system isn't related with the Jira application.

While the NFS problem isn't resolved, Jira might be in an unusable state, since Lucene won't work as expected. 
As part of Lucene Index initialization, *Lucene iterates over all mounted FS to check its properties*. So this issue will be triggered when Jira is restarted while the NFS problem is ongoing.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install a vanilla instance of Jira in Linux.
  #* This was validated with both Jira Core and Jira Software.
  #* The issue was validated on versions 8.11.1 and 8.15.0 (latest at time the bug was reported).
  #* The issue was validated with AdoptOpenJDK 8 and latest version of AdoptOpenJDK 11 HotSpot (11.0.10+9).
 # Create a few projects and navigate through pages to ensure everything is fine with the new installation.
 # On the OS level, create an NFS mount that is unrelated to the Jira application and make it unreachable.
{quote}
This helps creating a local NFS mount point on Ubuntu.
To make it simple, the Jira server is both the NFS server and client.
# Install NFS server and client.
{code}
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt install nfs-kernel-server nfs-common
{code}
# Create the export folder.
{code}
mkdir -p /tmp/sourcefolder
{code}
# Configure the NFS export file {{/etc/exports}} adding the following line.
{code}
/tmp/sourcefolder <server_ip_address>(rw,sync,no_subtree_check)
{code}
# Export the shared folder.
{code}
sudo exportfs -a
sudo systemctl restart nfs-kernel-server
{code}
# Create the mount point.
{code}
mkdir -p /tmp/targetfolder
{code}
# Configure {{/etc/fstab}} to mount the NFS adding the following line.
{code}
<server_ip_address>:/tmp/sourcefolder /tmp/targetfolder nfs defaults 0 0
{code}
# Mount NFS.
{code}
mount /tmp/targetfolder
df -h
{code}
# Deny access to port 2049 (NFS) from the local server.
{code}
sudo iptables -I INPUT -p tcp -i lo --dport 2049 -j DROP
{code}
 #* This simulates a hanging NFS mount, but totally unrelated to the application.
{quote}
# Restart Jira and wait for it to startup.
# Access an existing issue and add a new comment to it.
 #* This will trigger a reindex action.

Add collation change note - from utf8 to utf8mb4

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Jira 8.x, fields cannot be edited while copy-pasting the URL from one tab to another from issue filters

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue filter. Any simple filter will do, for example, Project filter.
 # In the created filter, open any issue ( note the filter ID in the URL).
# If you do a mouseover on fields like label etc, you can see the edit option clearly.
# Copy the URL (which has the filter id along with the issue number) and paste it in a new tab or browser window.

h3. Expected Results
Users should be able to edit fields and a pencil icon should be seen when the URL is opened in the new tab.

h3. Actual Results
 When you mouse over now on the fields, the edit option is not seen.

h3. Workaround 1
Click on the 'Edit' tab in the issue and then edit the required fields. 

h3.Workaround 2
Click on "Buttons" of search results to navigate to another issue and then get back to the initial one, after that it is possible to edit fields inline.
fields.summary: Issues not editable when a filter with tickets from a project is opened in a new browser tab/window

fields.description:
When try to add edit the comment containing more than 40 lines in the new tab then the comment window does not adjust as per the data added to the comment window. On trying to change the comment windows height from Inspect elements the height option is disabled and does not allow the option to change the height 

Added the screenshot of how the comment widows look unorganized and distorted.

It is replicable on all browsers and only replicable for version 8.15. I tested this with an older version and it works fine.

 

Steps to replicate:
 * Edit an issue
 * Edit a comment in the new tab which contain more than 40 lines 
 * Add few more details to the comment and see that height of the comment tab is not adjusted
 * Whereas when I checked this for other versions it worked fine
 * The issue is replicable both in Mozilla Firefox and Google Chrome
fields.summary: Ability to resize the height of Edit Comment Window on new tab

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The UI of Users and roles is broken for IE user. The customer cannot use it to add user to a role.
 It happened in customer' environment with below windows version, but it works normally when using Edge instead.
 * Version 1909(OS build 18363.1256)

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * _Project setting > Users and roles_

h3. Expected Results

UI  of Showing *Users and roles*  showing normally.
h3. Actual Results

UI  of Showing *Users and roles* is broken. 
h3. Workaround

Using other browser, like Edge, Chrome...
fields.summary: Users and roles is broken for IE user

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While running long JQL the Jira UI is not rendering properly because of the lack of a scrollbar

!image-2021-03-05-19-32-27-961.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enter the longest JQL in under issues dropdown > search for issues and click on enter

h3. Expected Results

The Jira UI should show the results with and the area where we enter JQL should expand but it's not rendering properly.
h3. Actual Results

The page will not render properly and the output will not be displayed completely
h3. Workaround

Adjusting the zoom level in the browser, as well as resizing the window, can partially allow for the results to be viewed, which can also be scrolled through.

Create another JQL filter that refers back to the long JQL filter in question, and utilize that filter whenever the JQL must be performed. (i.e. "filter = 12345"). Changes to the JQL can be performed directly on the original filter, which will be reflected in the new filter.
fields.summary: JQL query too large blocks the Issue List results

fields.description:
Comments in CSV export don't have information about comment visibility:
- for JSM projects is missing information about public/internal visibility
- for JSW projects is missing "Restricted for" information

Because of that if CSV export is used to import issues in Jira Cloud or other tools all comments are imported as public comments.

CSV export should contain these missing data if they are available.
fields.summary: Comments in CSV should contains visibilty information

fields.description:
At the moment, User directory information is displayed only in the admin screens of Jira. It would be useful to include this information either in the user's profile or any other non-admin screen.

An e.g. use case is in a large organization with a huge number of users, for users to get project access, they need to be added to the particular domain AD group and they have no way to see the user directory information in any non-admin screen

Currently, We have no workaround for this Suggestion ticket
fields.summary: Display User directory Information in User's Profile

fields.description:
Hi,

Currently the quick filters on the Jira boards do not have the option to create dynamic quick filters. For instance, I can create a quick filter on board to filter the issues associated to a specific component. So, if I've 4 components in my project, I'll have to create 4 different quick filters on my board to be able to filter by the component id. It would be really useful if the quick filters would support a drop down option to pick a value from, so I can pick the value to be used by the filter.
fields.summary: Dynamic Quick Filters on Jira Boards

fields.description:
Starting on SSO for Atlassian Server 4.2, the IdP configuration information will be moved to different tables in Jira and won't be available in Jira's support Zip anymore.

It would be great if we can put this information in the Support Zip for troubleshooting.
fields.summary: Jira Support Zip should include IdP configuration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Modifying original estimated and logged work doesn't result in the correct remaining estimate
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Create an item of type Bug/Story/Epic/Task/New Feature/Test Execution
 2. Edit it with original estimate 2h
 3. Log work 2h
 4. Go to the Edit button and modify the original estimate to 1h
 5. Modify logged work from 2h to 1h
h3. Expected Results

The correct 3 info on the right side of the test page: Original estimate: 1h, Remaining estimate: 0, Logged work: 1h
h3. Actual Results

The original estimate and logged work at the right side of the test are both with 1h, but the remaining estimate is also 1h, when it should be 0m
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Modifying original estimated and logged work doesn't result in the correct remaining estimate

fields.description:
Besides the existing options to handle undone issues on sprint close it would support the current state of our scaled approach best if there would be another option saying "Top of Backlog".

So, the desired result would end up in having all open issues re-ranked to the top of the backlog after closing the sprint. 

!image-2021-03-04-09-51-44-306.png!
fields.summary: Move undone issues to top of backlog on sprint close

fields.description:
h3. Summary

While navigating to the Search for issues page, the Jira log files are filled with FieldLayoutItem errors regarding null values:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Deploy a Jira Software 8.14.1+ instance
 # Navigate to *Issues* > *Search for issues*

h3. Expected Results

No error is thrown in the logs
h3. Actual Results

Below exception is thrown in the atlassian.log file:
{code:java}
2021-03-03 15:47:40,067-0300 http-nio-48141-exec-14 ERROR USER 947x680x1 1mngg04 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /issues/ [c.a.j.issue.fields.DefaultFieldManager] FieldLayoutItem for field named Archived with ID archiveddate is null. Usually this is a transient race condition due to concurrent modification. Please contact Atlassian support if you see this log message frequently.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

If we are using Multiline Text Fields, we can store more than 32,767 characters in the Field's value. When we export any issue in CSV format that has a Multiline Text Field with more than 32,767 characters stored in it, data is not exported properly, and the remaining characters of the Multiline Text field after the 32,767 characters are shifted to the Next line. Also, data for fields after the Multiline Text field is shifted to the next line in the CSV file.

Refer to the attached File Data_split_in_2_lines.csv where the custom Field (Multi_line) has more than 55k characters and data is split into 2 lines, while the data comes in a proper format in Data_in_Single_Line.csv where the custom Field (Multi_line) has around 20K characters.

Although this may be related to the Microsoft Excel having a character limit of 32,767 characters in a cell, it will be useful to have a feature to restrict the max characters that can be exported from a field while exporting issues in CSV/Excel format to avoid this.
fields.summary: Ability to restrict maximum characters for Fields while exporting Data is CSV format

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Managing workflow transitions can become a hurdle depending on how complex your workflow is and how many transitions exist in the workflow.
If you would like all of the transitions sharing similar configuration, but still having their own specifics, you would need to manage properties of each transition individually.

The only option an administrator have at the moment would be to use the same transition on all steps associated to the same target status.

If all transitions in a workflow shares the same configuration for _Triggers_, _Conditions_ and _Validators_, but each require a different setup for _Post functions_, then the only option is to individually configure each transition.

In case of a change on the shared configuration, the administrator needs to apply the same configuration on all transitions.

h3. Suggested Solution
There could be some sort of inheritance functionality for workflow transitions.
For example, we could have a _base_ transition configuration and _derived_ transitions, on which the later would inherit configuration from the former.
fields.summary: As a Jira administrator I would like to configure some sort of workflow transition inheritance to minimize the hurdle of managing several transitions on the same workflow

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When the user access a non existing URL in Jira, it will forward the user to a 404 error page.
As an example, accessing {{<Jira Base URL>/anything}} from the browser gives the user a page similar to the below.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
\\
\\

It is expected that Jira will respond with a 404 error to any non existing page in the system.
However, if the user tries to access {{<Jira Base URL>/<anything>/secure/<valid servlet>}}, then the page will be rendered instead of sending a 404.
\\
\\

For example, in Jira Core the _Manage Dashboards_ URL is {{<Jira Base URL>/secure/ConfigurePortalPages.jspa}}, which loads a page similar to the below.
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

If the user tries to access {{<Jira Base URL>/anything/secure/ConfigurePortalPages.jspa}}, then the page is rendered instead of sending a 404 error.
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
\\
\\

Depending on the page behind the {{<Jira Base URL>/secure/}} URL, the page renders with almost no error.
On other cases, it may render a page with unexpected contents.

An example of the above occurs when accessing the Agile Board of a Jira Software project.
A valid URL would be {{<Jira Base URL>/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=1&view=planning.nodetail&issueLimit=100}}, which would render a page similar to the below.
 !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail! 

Accessing {{<Jira Base URL>/anything/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=1&view=planning.nodetail&issueLimit=100}} would send the user to a page similar to the below, instead of a 404 page.
 !screenshot-5.png|thumbnail! 
\\
\\
In the above description we used {{<Jira Base URL>/anything/secure/...}} as an example, but the path {{/anything}} could be changed with any other string.
A valid use case for customers is when the Jira context path is removed, so users should access a different URL from what they are used to.
There may be cases when users keep bookmarks of the old URL with the context path.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install a vanilla instance of Jira Core.
  #* This was validated on versions 8.5, 8.13 and *8.15.0*.
 # Access {{<Jira Base URL>/anything/secure/ConfigurePortalPages.jspa}} in the browser.

h3. Expected Results
The 404 error page is shown to the user notifying this is not an existing page.

h3. Actual Results
The request is accepted and Jira will load a page.

h3. Workaround
_Currently there is no known workaround for the general behavior. A workaround will be added here when available._

In the case of context path removed, administrators may choose to work with rewrite rules in the load balancer / reverse proxy.
fields.summary: Accessing Jira-Base-URL/*/secure/* does not send the a 404 error

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Outgoing mail (SMTP) does not provide the option to authenticate via the oauth2.0 profile from the system admin UI.
Note that IMAP support is already implemented - JRASERVER-63917

h4. Latest update
Latest update on this matter: [Basic Authentication and Exchange Online – September 2021 Update|https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/exchange-team-blog/basic-authentication-and-exchange-online-september-2021-update/ba-p/2772210]
bq. Today, we are announcing that, effective October 1, 2022, we will begin to permanently disable Basic Auth in all tenants, regardless of usage, *with the exception of SMTP Auth*.
...
{quote}
Q: I thought you said you were not going to completely disable SMTP AUTH?
A: You’re right, we did, in blog posts here and here. We’re going to continue to disable SMTP AUTH for tenants who don’t use it, but we will not be changing the configuration of any tenant who does. We can’t tell though if the usage we see is valid or not, that’s down to you to determine. ... 
{quote}

h4. Previous updates 
* the Microsoft announcement in [https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/lifecycle/announcements/exchange-online-basic-auth-deprecated]:
{quote}
UPDATE February 25, 2021: Microsoft has postponed disabling Basic Auth for protocols in active use by tenants until further notice but will continue to disable Basic Auth for protocols not in use. Overall scope of this change now covers EWS, EAS, POP, IMAP, Remote PowerShell, MAPI, RPC, SMTP AUTH and OAB. 
..
Exchange Online is deprecating Basic Authentication for multiple protocols prior to its removal in the second half of 2021. Basic Authentication relies on sending usernames and passwords -- often stored on or saved to the device -- with every request, increasing risk of attackers capturing users' credentials, particularly if not TLS protected.
...
As part of security defaults, we currently disable Basic Authentication by default for new customers. During 2021, we'll start to disable Basic Authentication for existing customers who have no recorded usage of Basic Authentication in any of the protocols in scope of this announcement. After this change, apps will not be able to use Basic Authentication when connecting to Exchange Online using those protocols.
{quote}
* and related [Basic Authentication and Exchange Online – February 2021 Update|https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/exchange-team-blog/basic-authentication-and-exchange-online-february-2021-update/ba-p/2111904]
{quote}
The first change is that until further notice, we will *not* be disabling Basic Auth for any protocols that your tenant is *using*. When we resume this program, we will provide a minimum of *twelve months notice* before we block the use of Basic Auth on any protocol being used in your tenant.
...
Finally, we are aligning our plans with those for SMTP AUTH. We had previously announced that we would begin to disable SMTP AUTH for newly created tenants (and have already done so), and that we would expand this to disable SMTP AUTH for tenants who do not use it. We are continuing to do that, but we will include SMTP AUTH in all future communications and Message Center posts to make it easier for you to track the overall plan.
{quote}

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide support for OAuth 2.0 Outgoing mail (SMTP)
 
h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: As a Jira Administrator I want to configure OAuth 2.0 for Outgoing mail (SMTP)

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
# Add group-b as a member of group-a in the _Edit Nested Group Members_ configuration :

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In [Alternative Disaster Recovery Guide for Jira|https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/alternative-disaster-recovery-guide-for-jira-715360523.html], we have provided the following steps for failover:

{panel}
Step 1. Fail over to the standby instance

The basic steps to failover to the standby instance are:

# Ensure your live system is shutdown and no longer updating the database.
# Ensure that the directory  <yourjirahome>/old does not exist on the standby instance.
# Perform whatever steps are required to activate your standby database.
# Start Jira in the standby instance.
# Wait for Jira to start and check it is operating as expected.
# Update your DNS, HTTP Proxy or other front end devices to route traffic to your standby server.
{panel}

The steps above is missing the instruction to either restore the indexsnapshot manually or to use the "disaster.recovery=true." parameter while starting Jira (which will trigger automatic index restoration).

h3. Suggested Solution

Update the documentation and include the following step as step #2 in *Step 1. Fail over to the standby instance*:

{quote}
Start Jira in Disaster Recovery mode, by starting it with the following parameter: disaster.recovery=true.
{quote}

This should trigger automatic index recovery mechanism to kick in when the node is started during failover.
fields.summary: Update documentation for Disaster Recovery

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Importing a workflow using XML allows duplicate statuses with the same IDs and if both statuses have the same ID then the old one overwrites the newly created status name

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # extract the existing issue IDs by running the below command:
{code:sql}
select * from issuestatus;{code}
 # Export a workflow to XML and use any of the above-returned status IDs with different statuses in Jira the XML.
{code:java}
                  <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.issue.UpdateIssueStatusFunction</arg>
                </function>
                <function type="class">
                  <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.misc.CreateCommentFunction</arg>
                </function>
                <function type="class">
                  <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.issue.GenerateChangeHistoryFunction</arg>
                </function>
                <function type="class">
                  <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.issue.IssueReindexFunction</arg>
                </function>
                <function type="class">
                  <arg name="eventTypeId">13</arg>
                  <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.event.FireIssueEventFunction</arg>
                </function>
              </post-functions>
            </unconditional-result>
          </results>
        </action>
      </actions>
    </step>
{code}

We have changed the issue status ID to 10102 that is already existing in our local instance.
{code:java}
<step id="49" name="Pending on customer's side">
      <meta name="jira.status.id">10102</meta>
      <actions>{code}
 * Import the workflow by copying and pasting over the content of the XML
 * imported the workflow using the modified XML file and we observed that the status name is being overwritten in the Diagram mode however the text displayed newly imported workflow status name

h3. Expected Results

Jira throws a warning saying there's an existing status with the same ID and a different name

h3. Actual Results

Jira imports the workflow without any warnings but displays the newly created status in text mode, the old status name in diagram mode, or vice-versa

h3. Workaround

This is more seems to be related to the suggestion ticket :JRASERVER-43561-Validate workflow integrity before allowing addition to workflow scheme so the workaround provided might help
fields.summary: Importing a workflow using XML allows duplicate statuses with the same IDs and if both statuses have the same ID then the old one overwrites the newly created status name

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

ClassNotFoundException/NoClassDefFoundError (related to EventTriggerRuleComponent) is thrown when (some) apps are installed before Automation for Jira
This has been found with:
* Third party sample app
* ProForma: Forms and Fields for Jira
* Profields - Jira Project Tracking

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Build the attached "automation-thirdparty-sample-modified.zip" project. It is a trivially modified version of the official Automation sample app provided by Atlassian ([https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/automation-addon-sample/src/master/automation-thirdparty-sample/)].
 * LegacySampleCommentUpgradeTask class was removed to avoid an error during installation.

 
 * Marked the asterisk as optional in Import-Package to avoid this problem: JRASERVER-71831.

 
 * Compare the "pom.xml" with the original one to see some other minor differences.

Note: use "-Denforcer.skip=true" to avoid a build error with "atlas-package".

2. Install the modified sample app in Jira.

3. Install Automation for Jira.

4. "ClassNotFoundException: com.codebarrel.automation.api.thirdparty.EventTriggerRuleComponent not found" appears in the Jira log, but the installation is successful.

5. Create a new automation rule. Use trigger type "Issue commented" and add one "Log action" action with arbitrary message.

6. Add a comment to an issue.

7. "java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: com/codebarrel/automation/api/thirdparty/EventTriggerRuleComponent" error appears in the audit log and the Jira log.

8. Uninstall the modified sample app.

9. Install the modified sample app.

10. Add a comment to an issue.

11. The rule is executed without error.
h3. Expected Results

The third-party sample app and Automation for Jira can be installed in any order, no exceptions, automation rules are executed successfully.
h3. Actual Results

When the third-party sample app is installed before Automation for Jira, there are exceptions and automation rules fail.
h3. Workaround

* Reinstall the interfering app.
There should be no data/configuration loss as all the information is stored in the Jira database which is not affected by the reinstall.
fields.summary: ClassNotFoundException/NoClassDefFoundError (related to EventTriggerRuleComponent) is thrown when (some) apps are installed before Automation for Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On the issue view screen, when trying to add more than one attachment to the description field using the attachment button, the description field is automatically refreshed, making it impossible to add more attachment without clicking again on the edit button.

Because of that:
- multiple attachments can no longer be added to the description field while editing this field
- after each attachment is added, the user needs to click again on the edit button next to the description field to add a new one

Note that this bug occurs in both *Text* and *Visual* modes.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 !Bug.gif! 

h3. Expected Results

Description field does not auto refresh while adding multiple attachments at once

h3. Actual Results

Description field auto-refreshes and closes, needing to open again for each attachment you need to paste on it

h3. Workaround

The only way to add multiple attachments to the description field without the page auto-refreshing is to go to edit the description from the *Edit Issue* screen (instead of the *Issue View* screen), as shown in the screenshot below:
 !Workaround.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Description field auto-refreshes in issue view screen when adding an attachment to it

fields.description:
In the documentation at https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/reporting-939938675.html for "Created vs Resolved Issues Report", there is a bullet point in the expanded area that says:

"Viewing the chart — Areas in red show periods where more issues were created than resolved. Areas in green show periods where more were resolved than created."

My suggestion is to add another bullet point below that with the text:

"The optional Trend of Unresolved chart shows the cumulative change over time of Created less Resolved numbers. If the blue line is horizontal then you are creating and resolving issues at an equal rate. If the line is going up then you are creating more issues than you are resolving. If the line is going down then you are resolving more issues than you are creating"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we change the language preference to "Danish(Denmark)" and select the date from the "date picker field" then the date selected is flawed without a dot due to which while creating a ticket we see error as given below in the screenshot 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # create a date picker custom field
 # add the field to the screen for respective project
 # Go to the user profile and change the language to "Danish"
 # now create an issue and select the date
 # on creating an issue we see the error like "You have not entered a valid date. Enter the date in the format "d / MMM / yy", e.g. "25 / Feb / 21""
 # If we add the (.) as given here : 25/Feb./21 then we were able to create issue successfully

h3. Expected Results

The date should show correctly in danish format i.e *in the format as 25/Feb./21 instead of 25/Feb/21*

h3. Actual Results

The date selected shows without a dot which is expected in Danish format and hence we see the error as given below :You have not entered a valid date. Enter the date in the format "d / MMM / yy", e.g. "25/Feb/ 21"
 !image-2021-02-25-17-44-12-564.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Workaround

- This issue is only replicable in version 8.7.1 and not replicable in version 8.14. 
- Add a dot while adding the date field "25/Feb./21 manually to create issue
fields.summary: Danish dateformat flawed with a missing dot "."

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Inconsistent search result on alphanumeric text with dash (-). If the text has a dash and followed by a number (e.g. _abcd-1_), searching with the text alone does not return the issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create 6 issues with the summary below and empty description.
 ** goto/abcd-te1
 ** goto/abcd-te2
 ** goto/figh-abcd-te1
 ** goto/figh-abcd-te2
 ** goto/figh-abcd-tx
 ** goto/figh-abcd-vr
 # Search for issues with _abcd_ ( text ~ "abcd")
 # Search for issues with _abcd*_ ( text ~ "abcd*")
 # Search for issues with _te_ ( text ~ "te")
 # Search for issues with _te*_ ( text ~ "te*")
 # Search for issues with _(wildcard)te(wildcard)_
{noformat}
( text ~ "*te*")
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results
 * Searching with _abcd_ returns all 6 issues
 * Searching with _te_ returns 4 issues

h3. Actual Results
 * Searching with _abcd_ returns only the following 2. It looks like it only returns the issues that *do not have a number* in the summary.
 !image-2021-02-25-11-57-47-043.png|thumbnail!
 * Searching with _abcd*_ returns all 6 issues, but searching with _te*_ returns none.
 * Searching with _te_ returns 0 result too but searching with _(wildcard)te(wildcard)_ returns 4.
 !image-2021-02-25-11-57-59-982.png|thumbnail!

{panel:title=An even simpler scenario}
 # Create an issue with summary _lion-6_.
 # Create another issue with summary _lion-a_.
 # Search with _lion_ --> only _lion-a_ returns.
 # Search with _lion*_ --> both issues returns.{panel}
h3. Debug

The following are extracted from debug log while performing searches, to show words are being tokenized. The debug package is *com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers*, edited debug log is attached - [^debugLog.log] . Since "abcd-te1" is treated as one _word_, wildcard has to be used in the search term to include searching for this.
 * searching with _abcd_
{code:java}
JQL query: {text ~ "abcd"}

(+summary:abcd 
{code}

 * searching with _abcd*_
{code:java}
JQL query: {text ~ "abcd*"}

(+summary:abcd*
{code}

 * searching with _goto/abcd-te1_ (full summary) --> it's split into _goto_ and _abcd-te1_
{code:java}
JQL query: {text ~ "goto/abcd-te1"}

(+(+summary:goto +summary:abcd-te1)
{code}

 * searching with _goto/figh-abcd-te1_ (full summary) --> it's split into _goto_, _figh_ and _abcd-te1_
{code:java}
JQL query: {text ~ "goto/figh-abcd-te1"}

(+(+summary:goto +summary:figh +summary:abcd-te1)
{code}

h3. Workaround

Use wildcard in searching if it's common to have a dash follow by a number/alphanumeric text in the text fields
fields.summary: Inconsistent search result on alphanumeric text with dash

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Jira 8.12 there were accessibility improvements associated with focus management for keyboard-only users and as a result, blue frames started to appear unexpectedly on the user interface.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install one of the affected versions.
 # Upgrade your browser to one of its more recent versions.
 # Click on the *Jira Administration Icon* > *Projects*.
 # Select the correct project from the list.
 # You should be taken to the *Project settings* page. Click on *Users and Roles* at the sidebar.
 # Click on the *Add users to a role* button.

h3. Expected Results
* The user interface will be properly displayed.

h3. Actual Results
* A blue frame appears around the cursor.
 !Screen Shot 2021-02-25 at 03.36.05.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Focus management improvements resulting in unexpected blue frames displayed in the user interface

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Many other Jira windows like this, require me to clear the current value before I can type. This window did NOT clear the current value. When I am adding a group in a Jira Permission scheme, I must clear the current default value before I start typing, or it types after the default value.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Adminstiation>Issues>Permissions Schemes
 # Edit a permission 
 # Select Group
 #  When I am adding a group in a Jira Permission scheme, I must clear the current default value before I start typing, or it types after the default value.

h3. Expected Results

Either typing allows automatic clearing of default value, OR the ability to clear the default value, but not a mixture since this is confusing.
h3. Actual Results

Keeps the original group and keeps typing letters after the group name
h3. Workaround
 # Clear the Group entry
 # Type Group Name
 # Select Grant
fields.summary: Must Clear group in "Grant permission to" in order to add another group

fields.description:
This is an umbrella ticket and hold *Jira*, *JSM* and *Confluence* mobile client needs. And relates to both Android and Apple based devices.
h2. What is MAM

Mobile device management (MDM) is a device lifecycle management technology that enables IT to deploy, configure, manage, support and secure mobile devices through MDM profiles installed on the devices. 

Mobile application management (MAM) technologies apply management and policy controls to individual apps instead of the entire device. MAM solutions typically offer a custom app store that enables control and delivery of both internally-developed and third-party apps. IT admins can add security, encryption and control to mobile apps using AppConfig Community standards or software development kit (SDK) or app wrapping solutions from the MAM provider.

 

Good examples of MAM policies:
 * Android: [https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/apps/app-protection-policy-settings-android]

 * iOS [https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/apps/app-protection-policy-settings-ios]

referenced as example, no particular sticking to MS Intune. In general allows a precise control of how data flows. And especially for BYOD company policy ensure that document won't leave corporate perimeter.
h2. Requirement Gathering

We feel a high demand on MAM and looking for a way on mobile to give the best option(s) possible.

MAM Providers are not defined, if you do NOT see yours let us know, we heard a lot MS Intune, VMWare AirWatch, MobileIron, Blackberry.

Thus we evaluate several options that might work:
 * Application Wrapping
 ** pre-wrapping: Stores will contain apps ready for MAM Provider
 ** self-service: Provided service that allows to get binaries and wrap them inHouse
 * SDK binding (not for every MAM)
 * Based on MDM solution

 

This is an umbrella ticket and later on may fall into smaller parts. Please comment actively and we'll split it.
fields.summary: MAM Server Mobile Support
